MS MCQs

    Foundations of cloud computing for developers - Building blocks of the cloud

    »

    1. Which of the following is true about SaaS?

      SaaS is a software model in which updates and patches are not required to be installed manually by every end user.

      SaaS is a software model in which a cloud vendor hosts services. Those services are made available to end users over a network, typically the internet.

      SaaS is software that is made available to the end user over a browser or mobile application.

      All of the above


    2. A company is creating new algorithms for accurate face recognition software. The company is interested in moving to the cloud for its application development needs. Is software as a service the right model for this particular project?

      Yes

      No


    3. Azure’s App Service is an example of PaaS. Given that you read the PaaS section, which of the following statements about App Service is incorrect?

      The applications deployed on App Service have the same security, privacy, and data protection policies that Microsoft’s applications have. Hence, end users can take advantage of the reliability, performance, and security of Azure’s infrastructure.

      Customers have the flexibility to decide the number and configuration of physical servers required for hosting an application.

      App Service provides customers with web-based user-interface creation tools to help create and modify the application’s APIs.


    4. Which of the following is considered to be a characteristic of IaaS?

      IaaS providers do not allow clients to scale resources on demand.

      IaaS providers provide computing resources to clients in the form of instances or virtual machines.

      Users are aware of whom they share physical resources with.
